title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Tata Steel arm faces $1.6 billion class action lawsuit in Dutch court over alleged health damage
items.summary:
- Stichting Frisse Wind filed a WAMCA collective action in the District Court of North Holland against Tata Steel Nederland B.V. and Tata Steel IJmuiden B.V. seeking about $1.6 billion for alleged environmental and health damages near Velsen-Noord.
- Writ served Dec 19, 2025 on residents; claimants allege emissions increased health risks and depressed home values; Tata Steel denies the claims and plans to defend.
- Two-phase proceedings (admissibility and merits) are expected to take 2-3 years each; Tata Steel says it is investing in environmental improvements via Roadmap+ and Green Steel Plan.

items.title: Rural demand driving construction equipment market, say CASE Construction top executives
items.summary:
- Rural demand is decentralising from metros to tier-2/3 towns as rural projects rise; first-time buyers acquire loaders, compactors and excavators locally, while large fleets still buy in bulk.
- Government schemes like Jal Jeevan Mission and PMGSY are boosting demand; CASE links with financiers and an NBFC to expand retail finance; rising telematics improve service, fuel use and reminders.
- Outlook: Stage-V prompted machine redesign with 2-10% model gains; 2025-26 recovery expected, with high single-digit growth in 2026 on a low base; rural infrastructure and service capability are key drivers.

items.title: Dilip Buildcon bags ₹3,400 crore EPC order for Ganga Path road in Bihar
items.summary:
- Dilip Buildcon bags ₹3,400 crore EPC to build 41.09-km Ganga Path from Sultanganj–Bhagalpur to Sabour, Bihar, with a 42-month window from start.
- Project on a back-to-back basis with Bihar State Road Development Corporation as employer; scope includes design, engineering, procurement, construction, testing and commissioning.
- Declared L-1 bidder by REC PDC Ltd for a 400 kV sub-station at Mekhali, Belagavi, Karnataka (400/220/33 kV AIS) and associated lines; also received a ₹879.30 crore LOA from NHAI for four-laning NH-87 Paramakudi–Ramanathapuram in Tamil Nadu.

items.title: Colgate India gets ₹267 crore demand order from taxman
items.summary:
- Colgate-Palmolive (India) has a ₹267.64 crore tax demand for FY2021-22, driven by transfer-pricing adjustments and disallowance of certain expenses.
- The company will appeal to the tax tribunal; the management asserts the demand does not impact operations or financials.
- In the September quarter, net profit fell 17% YoY, with industry concerns about tax certainty and dispute resolution affecting ease of doing business.

items.title: Want to be known as world leader in power electronics: Suramya Nevatia, CMD, Hind Rectifiers
items.summary:
- Suramya Nevatia says power electronics is core across rail, defence, mobility and energy; Hind Rectifiers shifts from components to end-to-end train systems with in-house propulsion and control.
- Locomotives (~6,000 hp) are the proving ground; Railways offer long demand visibility; the group diversifies beyond rail toward modules and integrated solutions with gradual overseas roll-out.
- By 2030–2035, Hind Rectifiers aims to be a world leader in power electronics, anchored by IP and in-house R&D; exports target 20–30% of revenue.

items.title: At WTO, India calls for steps to boost tech transfer to developing nations
items.summary:
- Calls on WTO members to adopt measures that promote transfer of relevant, advanced and environmentally sound technology to developing nations and LDCs.
- Highlights barriers such as export controls on inputs (semiconductors, rare earths) and inflexible IP regimes, urging transparency and a fair share in trade.
- Pushes a time-bound roadmap to operationalise TRIPS flexibilities and tech-transfer provisions before the next ministerial conference.

items.title: Jewellery, rugs and toys power creative goods' export surge
items.summary: - Exports rose 7.3% YoY to $12.5B (Apr–Oct FY26), led by fashion jewellery, crafts, carpets and toys; UAE 31% of shipments, US 26.1%.\n- Front-loading from US tariffs and Christmas orders boosted shipments; lab-grown diamonds gain traction in fashion jewellery with buyers in US, Spain, UK, UAE, NL.\n- India held ~3% of global creative goods exports in 2023; high gold prices boost imitation jewellery as FTAs loom and 2026 outlook remains challenging.

items.title: Dept of atomic energy seeks sops to put N-Power on a par with RE
items.summary:
- DAE seeks GST waivers, green financing, renewables-like purchase obligations, green taxonomy inclusion, and removal from CPCB Red status.
- Nuclear power emits near-zero CO2 but isn’t treated as renewable; post-Shanti Bill 2025 regime opens private investment.
- GST deemed exports exclude nuclear (18% IGST vs ~5% for renewables); customs exemptions extended to Sept 2027; India targets 100 GW by 2047 from 8.78 GW.

items.title: Now hiring: Leaders for a ‘Global’ India
items.summary:
- GCCs in India are shifting from transactional back-office hubs to strategic, expanding leadership in product, engineering, data, AI, cybersecurity and digital operations.
- ANSR projects GCC leadership headcount rising from about 6,500 end-2024 to about 8,500 end-2025, with roughly 40% more by end-2026; BFSI, retail and consumer durables show high-growth momentum and cross-sector demand.
- Firms such as Albertsons, McDonald’s, FedEx, Sanofi and Intuit are expanding GCC leadership, signaling AI-native operating models and India-owned global portfolios across sectors.

items.title: Taiwan’s MediaTek is open to sourcing more India chips
items.summary:
- MediaTek is open to sourcing more India chips as the ecosystem matures, shifting between assembly and manufacturing based on cost and foundry readiness.
- Fabless MediaTek holds ~46% of India's chipset market and is expanding a 1,000-strong India R&D footprint to integrate hardware, software, AI and connectivity.
- It targets premium Dimensity chips, automotive and data-center solutions, on-device AI with NPUs, and says 2030 success will rely on IoT and automotive ecosystem leadership not market share.

items.title: India Inc wants to tech all its employees to the future
items.summary:
• India Inc is lining up 2026 upskilling targets with data, AI and analytics at the core, backed by academia partnerships and in‑house learning ecosystems.
• Firms such as GCPL, EY, Zensar, Tata Motors and Diageo are launching or expanding learning platforms and forums (RIDE, AI Varsity, Learning University) to future‑proof talent.
• The strategy ties learning to promotions, emphasizes bite‑size content, and aligns HR with disruptions in hydrogen propulsion, batteries and software‑defined vehicles.

items.title: Exports likely to grow by 3% to ₹850 bn this fiscal: GTRI
items.summary:
- GTRI projects India’s total exports at about USD 850 bn in FY26, up ~3% from FY25, with services possibly exceeding USD 400 bn.
- Goods exports likely flat; headwinds include protectionism, weaker global demand, and climate-related barriers like the EU’s CBAM from Jan 2026.
- External environment is deteriorating; CBAM costs impact steel exports to the EU; calls for sector-by-sector FTAs to better integrate firms into global value chains.

items.title: New labour codes may reshape MNC payrolls
items.summary:
- India’s broader wage definition under the labour codes could reshape cost bases for seconded/expat staff and TP, triggering adjustments if benchmarks change or docs are weak.
- The revised wage framework will affect wage definitions, social contributions, compliance timelines and benefits, altering payroll structures and overall CTC, requiring cross-functional rollout.
- Aggressive reclassification of salary components may attract GAAR if arrangements lack commercial substance; robust rationale, board approvals and mappings to old components are essential.

items.title: India's engineering goods exports record strong rebound in November at $11.01 billion: EEPC
items.summary:
- Engineering exports rose to $11.01B in Nov 2025, up 23.76% YoY from $8.90B in Nov 2024; first time crossing $11B in the current fiscal. 
- Apr–Nov 2025–26 exports total $79.74B, up 4.25% YoY; US ($1.58B, +11.4%) and EU ($2.02B, +39%) are top destinations. 
- 32 of 34 product panels grew; engineering's share of total merchandise exports rose to 28.9%; policy supports and potential FTAs with EU/US on the horizon.

items.title: North Korea displays apparent progress in construction of nuclear-powered submarine
items.summary:
- KCNA photos show an 8,700-ton hull of a nuclear-powered submarine largely complete, with Kim Jong Un visiting the shipyard to stress modernization and deterrence.
- Analysts say core components, including engine and possibly the reactor, may be installed, hinting at sea trials within months; reactor sourcing is debated.
- The move is part of Kim's broader weapons push and raises tensions as South Korea eyes a U.S.-backed submarine program.

items.title: Samsung rules out India listing, to focus on AI-integration, interest-free finance to fuel growth
items.summary:
- Samsung rules out India listing and will push AI integration across devices, expanding Finance+ EMI to home appliances, funded internally with optional borrowings.
- It will deepen its Noida footprint, push display manufacturing under the PLI, and grow exports with AI-driven differentiation in rural and north/east markets.
- AI is a cornerstone for future products, with CES 2026 AI appliances and on-device AI Vision via Google Gemini; India hosts 10,000+ engineers across 3 R&D centers.

items.title: Ola Electric gets ₹366.78 crore PLI-Auto incentive sanction for FY25
items.summary:
- Ola Electric sanctioned ₹366.78 crore under the government PLI Auto scheme for FY25.
- Payment will be disbursed via IFCI Limited and tied to demand incentives linked to determined sales value.
- Aims to boost domestic auto manufacturing, advanced technologies, and India's global competitiveness in clean mobility.

items.title: Lamborghini bets on hybrids to drive sustainable growth, manufacturing overhaul
items.summary:
- Lamborghini aims for carbon-neutral operations at Sant’Agata Bolognese while shifting to hybrid powertrains, cutting CO2 since 2014.
- The Manufacturing \"Manufactura Lamborghini\" enables ICE, hybrid and EV on a single line, mixing automation with craftsmanship.
- A factory expansion adds an in-house paint shop, more on-site solar, water monitoring and circular economy practices with safety and upskilling for high-voltage systems.

items.title: Sun Pharma arm recalls over 17,000 units of antifungal shampoo in US: USFDA
items.summary: - Taro Pharmaceuticals (a Sun Pharma unit) recalls 17,664 Ciclopirox Shampoo bottles in the US due to impurity/degradation specs; Class II recall began Dec 9.\n- Ciclopirox Shampoo is used to treat seborrheic dermatitis (antifungal).\n- The 2024 merger made Taro a private subsidiary of Sun Pharma; Sun Pharma has been the majority owner since 2010.

items.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw: Rahul Gandhi's praise for Karnataka jobs affirms Make in India success
items.summary:
- Rahul Gandhi praised Karnataka's Foxconn-linked hiring: ~30,000 jobs in 8–9 months; majority women (≈80%), many aged 19–24.
- Vaishnaw called Gandhi's remarks proof of Make in India; notes Covid-era push to diversify Apple suppliers under PLI for mobiles/electronics.
- Foxconn expanding in India, especially Tamil Nadu, with possible new facilities in Uttar Pradesh; incentives from BJP-led states and center.

items.title: HCCB, Coca-Cola India’s bottling arm, to lay off 300 employees; move to streamline operations
items.summary:
- Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages to lay off about 300 employees (4–6% of ~5,000) to streamline operations across sales, supply chain, distribution and bottling.
- CEO Hemant Rupani (ex-Mondelez) guiding the unit under Coca-Cola’s concentrate-to-bottler model; operates 15 manufacturing units.
- FY25 net profit fell 73% to ₹756.64 crore and revenue declined 9% to ₹12,751.29 crore amid base effects from bottling-sale exits and muted demand due to unseasonal rains.

items.title: Amit Shah inaugurates ₹2 Lakh crore projects at MP Growth Summit, boosting employment
items.summary:
- Amit Shah inaugurated the Abhyudaya MP Growth Summit in Gwalior, unveiling projects worth ₹2 lakh crore and a groundbreaking ceremony.
- The event saw renovation of the Atal Museum and the launch of the Gwalior Fair, with about 25,000 beneficiaries and numerous entrepreneurs and investors.
- Officials project about 1.93 lakh employment opportunities, framing MP's growth as part of a holistic Viksit Bharat vision.

items.title: Samsung SDI, KG Mobility form alliance for cylindrical battery pack for future EVs: Report
items.summary:
- Samsung SDI and KG Mobility have signed a long-term strategic alliance to co-design, test, and validate cylindrical battery packs based on Samsung SDI’s 46-series cells for KG Mobility’s next-generation EVs. 
- The 46-series cells are designed for high energy density using nickel, cobalt, aluminum and silicon-carbon technology to enable longer range and faster charging while maintaining safety. 
- The partners will share global battery-market strategies and conduct joint R&D, signaling cylindrical chemistry as a growth area amid rising demand for producible, scalable battery solutions.

items.title: Adani seals ₹80,000 crore in deals since 2023 Hindenburg crisis
items.summary:
- Since Jan 2023, Adani has closed 33 acquisitions totalling ~₹80,000 crore, led by ports, cement and power.
- The largest deal: ₹21,700 crore for North Queensland Export Terminal (April 2025).
- Analysts cite improved transparency, lender engagement, deleveraging and a planned ~₹10 lakh crore capex over five years to restore investor confidence.

items.title: India likely to miss $1 trillion export target in FY26 as global slowdown hits shipments: GTRI
items.summary: - India is unlikely to hit FY26's $1 trillion export target; GTRI projects total exports at about $850 billion, leaving roughly a $150 billion shortfall. - Goods growth is expected to stay flat with only marginal services growth; major gains may require new trade deals with the US and EU, likely next year; early diversification shows US shipments down ~20.7% (May–Nov) while rest‑of‑world exports are up ~5.5%. - BRICS remains a loose bloc; rupee depreciation reflects global rates; recommendations include a tougher WTO stance and coalitions with like‑minded nations (South Africa, Brazil) to shield agriculture, while domestic growth stays solid with low inflation.

items.title: China’s chip rules unfair, says US, but will delay tariffs to 2027
items.summary: - US trade officials will delay imposing Section 301 tariffs on China for 18 months after a probe found Beijing's semiconductor-dominance tactics unfair and burdensome to US commerce.\n- The investigation alleges China uses extensive state support for private actors and wage-suppressing labor practices to shape chip markets.\n- The current 0% tariff will rise after June 23, 2027 to a rate to be announced at least 30 days prior; Beijing criticizes the move as harming the global supply chain.

items.title: GI tag, carbon tax & intellectual property rights on top for India in January trade talks with EU
items.summary:
- Jan 2026 talks cover GI-tagged goods, mineral export controls, IP rights, and CBAM; GI pact lists exchanged and stainless-steel carve-outs.
- EU to expand CBAM to ~180 goods and tighten anti-circumvention; CBAM certificates from Feb 1, 2027 for 2026 imports; talks on Investment Protection Agreement and GI pact.
- FY25 India-EU goods trade ~ $136.5B; 14th FTA round in Oct; negotiators aim to finish by year-end with market-access concessions.

items.title: Russia plans a nuclear power plant on the moon within a decade
items.summary:
- Roscosmos aims to build a lunar nuclear power plant by 2036 to power rovers, an observatory and ILRS infrastructure for long-term exploration.
- Lavochkin Association leads the project with Rosatom and the Kurchatov Institute, signaling active involvement of Russia's nuclear sector.
- The goal is a permanently functioning scientific lunar station, marking a shift from one-off missions amid US/China competition; nuclear details are not explicitly stated.

items.title: Oswal Pumps secures ₹180 crore order under PM-KUSUM
items.summary:
- Oswal Pumps has won a ₹180 crore order from MSEDCL under PM-KUSUM B for 6,500 Off-Grid DC SPWPS to be delivered in 12 months.
- The contract value includes GST and is backed by a Letter of Empanelment under the Magel Tyala Saur Krishi Pump Yojana.
- PM-KUSUM, launched in 2019, targets 34,800 MW of solar capacity by March 2026 to boost rural irrigation.

items.title: Gujarat crosses 5 lakh rooftop solar installations, achieves 1,879 MW capacity; success stories to shine at VGRC Rajkot
items.summary:
- Gujarat crosses 5 lakh rooftop solar installations totaling 1,879 MW under PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojna, to be highlighted at VGRC Rajkot.
- State has installed over 11 lakh rooftop systems; aims to reach 10 lakh residential rooftops by March 2027 with subsidies.
- Policy measures under CM Bhupendra Patel cut charges, waive network strengthening, no net metering requirement, no banking charges; subsidies up to Rs 78,000 per system to improve access.

The European laws curbing Big Tech & irking Trump

India must accelerate deep manufacturing to build resilience against tariffs and export pressure: GTRI
items.summary:
- Make deep manufacturing the core growth strategy over five years to create jobs, boost exports, and promote inclusive growth, adopting an inward production model. 
- Exports are ~20% of GDP; facing US protectionism; India aims for EU fast-track FTA and FTAs with Oman and NZ to expand trade; MSMEs need working capital and competitiveness. 
- US de-dollarisation, BRICS dynamics, and rupee volatility drive external risk; manufacturing relocation could resume with a US deal, with stronger exports easing pressures.

items.title: How a Silicon Valley dealmaker charmed Trump and gave Intel a lifeline
items.summary:
- Trump attacked Lip-Bu Tan; Intel then secured a 40-minute Oval Office meeting where a deal was floated: roughly 10% equity in Intel backed by $5.7B to revive domestic manufacturing.
- Tan’s private deal made the U.S. Intel’s largest shareholder; Nvidia later added $5B; leadership reshaping followed, with Pushkar Ranade named chief of staff/interim CTO amid potential conflicts with his venture firms.
- Analysts call the White House lifeline crucial for Intel but flag ongoing manufacturing hurdles and policy-tilt risks, with AI ties and 18A/14A progress in focus.

items.title: Inside Tembo’s defence push and the strategy behind its next manufacturing leap
items.summary:
- Vasai plant becomes integrated hub; exports 80-85%; capacity scalable 4-5x; Amravati defence facility planned with Austrian tech transfer.
- Amravati to be 100% automated; Vasai 25-30%; licensing 6-12 months; emphasis on quality, compliance and scale.
- China-plus-one strategy with MEA expansion; target ₹6,000 crore order book in 2 years; sustainability, new products and ethics.

items.title: INOX Air Products flags off India’s first LNG-fuelled cryogenic tanker
items.summary:
- INOX Air Products unveils India’s first LNG-fueled cryogenic tanker with a 450-litre Kryopower LNG tank, designed and built in Gujarat.
- The Vadodara launch was flagged off by P Seeniraj after a DPIIT policy update (June 2025) permitting LNG as transport fuel for cryogenic vehicles.
- LNG adoption could cut CO2 by up to 25% and particulates by 95%, with in-state gas production and Gujarat-focused deployment marking a milestone in industrial gas logistics.

items.title: Indian consumer giants' CEOs changing at a pace not seen since Covid
items.summary:
- In 2025, Indian consumer giants saw rapid CEO/MD churn as boards push for faster growth amid digital disruption.
- Notables: HUL promotes Priya Nair; Nestlé India names Manish Tiwary; Arvind Fashions appoints Amisha Jain; Britannia and L’Oréal also reshuffle.
- Industry-wide, ~40% of BSE 200 CEOs changed in 3 years as firms seek digital-first leadership to beat margin pressure and omni-channel competition.

items.title: Juniper Green Energy commissions 60 MWh of 100 MWh merchant BESS project in Rajasthan
items.summary:
- Juniper Green Energy commissioned 60 MWh of its 100 MWh merchant BESS at Bikaner, Rajasthan, via Juniper Green Cosmic Private Limited, marking its first operational merchant storage asset.
- The 60 MWh unit completed trials and received NRLDC approval; commercial operations began on 24 December 2025, with the remaining 40 MWh expected to be commissioned soon for peak arbitrage, grid-balancing and ancillary markets.
- Separately, Juniper has 400 MWh installed at Fatehgarh and plans further BESS deployments across ISTS-connected solar sites to support grid stability and renewables integration.

items.title: Vikran Engineering wins ₹2,035 crore order for 600 MW solar projects in Maharashtra
items.summary:
- Vikran Engineering won a ₹2,035 crore turnkey EPC contract to develop 600 MW of solar projects across Maharashtra for Onix Renewables.
- The scope covers design, engineering, procurement, erection, testing and commissioning, including supplying PV modules and inverters, with 12-month completion.
- MD Rakesh Markhedkar highlighted engineering depth and project-management strength; Vikran has delivered 45 projects across 14 states and aims to expand into large infra.

items.title: Naxatra Labs raises $3 mn funding to scale EV, industrial motor tech
items.summary:
- $3M funding round led by Rainmatter (Zerodha) on Dec 24, 2025, with participation from industry leaders.
- Funds to accelerate new motor platforms, expand engineering/ops teams, scale manufacturing, and target about 50,000 motors/month plus stronger international reach.
- Naxatra offers end-to-end EV/industrial motor tech from EM design to production for domestic and export markets; co-founder says it will meet rising demand and bolster India's manufacturing footprint.

items.title: Why AI is the new currency of space in supply chains
items.summary:
- AI reframes optimization around space, using volumetric planning and real-time data to maximize utilization and cut hidden costs.
- AI acts as an orchestrator, simulating feasible plans before execution to reduce underutilized capacity, congestion, and carbon footprint while easing human cognitive load.
- The shift to AI-led, space-centric supply chains promises greater resilience and scalability, especially where infrastructure is constrained.

items.title: India Inc needs to push up capex instead of keeping cash on books: EAC-PM chairman S Mahendra Dev
items.summary:
- GDP growth is projected around 7–7.5% in FY26 and ~7% in FY27, with inflation easing and macro stability supporting policy flexibility.
- Fiscal consolidation continues with a debt-to-GDP target near 56% in FY26 and deficits under 4.5% of GDP by 2025–26, alongside ongoing reforms.
- Public investment aims to crowd in private capex, aided by ease of doing business gains, labour reforms, and Make in India/Swadeshi to boost manufacturing.

items.title: China challenges India’s PLI schemes, import duties at World Trade Organization
items.summary:
- China filed a WTO consultation against India's PLI schemes and import duties, arguing incentives tied to domestic inputs discriminate against Chinese goods.
- Beijing targets PLI measures for PV cells and modules, smartphones, semiconductors and related machinery, plus the AIDC on electronics manufacturing equipment.
- If talks fail, a dispute panel could be formed; the Appellate Body has been non-functional since 2019 due to the US blockage, limiting appeals.

items.title: HMEL to invest ₹2,600cr at Guru Gobind Singh Refinery, Bathinda
items.summary:
- HMEL to invest ₹2,600 crore to develop polypropylene downstream and new fine chemical projects at Bathinda's Guru Gobind Singh Refinery; plan announced by MD and CEO Prabh Das with Punjab's industry minister.
- Punjab is a growing polypropylene hub; Bathinda refinery now meets about 14% of India's polypropylene demand and contributes 5-6% of national petrol/diesel output.
- The government is exploring a dedicated plastic industrial park near Ludhiana; HMEL also plans petrol pumps across Punjab, with future multi-fuel pumps including CNG and EV charging.

items.title: Bristol Myers lines up many launches for India with 'AI' speed
Gujarat solar equipment makers to invest ₹1700cr in Ratlam
items.summary:
- Hexatron to invest ₹1,700 crore in Ratlam IR MP to build solar equipment & components plant, creating about 3,000 direct jobs.
- With this, Ratlam IR total commitments rise to ~₹12,000 crore across five units, in line with Centre/state clean-energy & domestic-manufacturing goals.
- MPIDC says the deal is a milestone, boosts investor confidence, and will spur ancillary activity in logistics, packaging, fabrication, maintenance and services to energize Ratlam's economy.

items.title: Belrise Industries, Plasan Sasa to jointly manufacture EV components for military vehicles in India
